entities.name: lily
entities.description: Lily is a person who is surprised and welcoming when she sees Tuney, but later becomes alarmed and accusatory towards Snape. She says 'Tuney!' twice in the text, indicating that Tuney is someone or something important to her.

entities.name: snape
entities.description: Snape is a person who is initially standing and then jumps to his feet when he sees Petunia. He is accused by Lily of hurting Petunia, but denies it.

entities.name: petunia
entities.description: Petunia is a person who is caught spying and is accused by Snape of being a spy. She is later hurt by a falling branch and bursts into tears.

entities.name: tuney
entities.description: Tuney is someone or something that Lily is surprised to see, as indicated by her exclamation 'Tuney!'

relationships.description: Lily accuses Snape of hurting Petunia, but he denies it. This is indicated by the text 'You did! You hurt her!' and Snape's response 'No — no, I didn’t!'
Lily is concerned about Petunia when she sees her being hurt by the falling branch. This is indicated by the text 'Lily screamed' and 'She was backing away from him'.
Snape's actions (or lack thereof) are accused by Lily of causing harm to Petunia. This is indicated by the text 'You did! You hurt her!'
